entry.def: A lead-in is something that is said or done as an introduction before the main subject or event, especially before a radio or television programme.

example.ex: They were thrilled, finally, to have a decent lead-in for their 9 a.m. local programs.
example.tran: 终于，他们为上午9点播出的本地节目有了一段像样的片头而高兴得不得了。

means.word_mean: 1. the introductory section of a story;

sentences.sentence: "it was an amusing lead-in to a very serious matter"

means.word_mean: 2. wire connecting an antenna to a receiver or a transmitter to a transmission line
